newsitem.title: FINLAND: Forestry shares sharply ahead in Helsinki.
newsitem.headline: Forestry shares sharply ahead in Helsinki.

text.p: Forestry shares rose sharply on Friday in fairly active trade boosted by a surge in Swedish forestries on the Stockholm bourse late on Thursday, brokers said.
At 1255/1055 GMT, shares in Europe's biggest forest-industry group UPM-Kymmene were up nearly four percent or 3.30 markka at 92.20 markka.
Enso rose over four percent or 1.60 markka to 36.40 markka, and Metsa-Serla was up 1.30 markka at 31.00.

Brokers said trading had largely focused on the upturn in forestry issues, which made up 44 percent of the bourse volume. UPM was heaviest traded and it accounted for nearly 30 percent of bourse trading volume.
